chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deparis Martice Hardin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Deparis Martice Hardin.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for plea hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Deparis Martice Hardin.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander James Geocaris appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. For reasons stated on the record, defense requests plea hearing date. Court grants request.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is asking for additional time to pursue NGI plea. State has no objection. Case is adjourned in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court reviews doctor's report with the parties; doctor's evaluation does not support an NGI plea.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Invoice dated 4/26/2022 20 sent to Accts Payable Dept on 5/6/22 in the amount of $718.75 to Dr. Deborah Collins for services on 3/23/22, 4/5/22, 4/8/22.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court he has not yet been able to meet with defendant to review the doctor's report and requests adjournment of today's scheduled hearing.
Court grants request and orders case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
from Deborah L. Collins, Psy.D., ABPP dated April 8, 2022 - received

Order for Examination under s.s. 971.16, Wis. Stats. (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  

Defendant was arraigned in open court.  On behalf of the defendant, defense enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 971.16.  
Court appoints Dr. Deborah Collins to conduct the examination. 

Order for Examination under 971.16, Wis. Stats. to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.

Court orders case adjourned for return of doctors report in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  D.R.B.  and/or   A.A.R.   and/or   M.F.S.   and/or   A.E.W.

Bail arguments to the Court.

Court sets bail at $10,000 cash.

Further, Court issues No Contact Order

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  

Court will address bail.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin (appears via Zoom video) with Attorney Christopher John Ertl (appears in person).  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Atty. Ertl is now counsel of record.

Parties in court to review the doctor's report.
Parties in receipt of examiner's report.
State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.  Defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
There being no challenge to the report by the State, defense counsel or defendant Court adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his defense.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed and orders the proceedings reinstated.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to initial appearance.
Defense Notice Of Motion And Motion To Withdraw - received
Received and filed
from Jenna Niess, Psy.,D. dated February 2, 2022 - received
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Colleen Cullen in court, defendant Deparis Martice Hardin not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court has been notified that the examination has not yet been completed.  Forensics is requesting additional time to prepare the report.

Court orders case adjourned for return of doctor's report in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Letter from Jenna Niess to the court dated January 11, 2022 - received

Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Deparis Martice Hardin in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
